alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Hall; Lumpkin (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 4:25AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lumpkin, eastern Dawson and northwestern Hall Counties through 500 AM EST... At 425 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Nimblewill to near Auraria to Silver City, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dahlonega, Dawsonville, Dougherty, Camp Merrill, Murrayville, Black Gap Shelter, Auraria, Garland, Porter Springs, Turners Corner, Nimblewill, Gooch Mountain Shelter, McKee and Blood Mountain Shelter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
